body:
It would be handy if $spack worked in environment's spack.yaml file, as it does in `config.yaml`.

### Rationale

I'd like to be able to refer to the root of the spack installation when describing the root of a view in an environment's `spack.yaml`.

Current choices seem to absolute paths and relative paths (which seem to be relative the the cwd when `spack install` is run.

When I tried using `$spack/foo` I ended up with a view rooted at the literal `$spack/foo`.

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
   - `0.14.1-684-f912cce7e`
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: it would be handy if $spack worked in environment's spack.yaml file
